website_summaries.verdict: Many of the brand’s long-term customers were disappointed that the Reebok Club MEMT is flimsier and not as comfortable as some of the older Reebok models. Also, the majority were not impressed by the Memory Tech sock liner as it was too thin and too soft. Overall, it is still a good shoe given how stylish and classic it is, but it probably is not the right shoe for those who need to be on their feet all day or those who do a lot of walking.
pros: Many purchasers claimed that the Reebok Club MEMT is the kind of sneaker that could be worn with any casual outfit
One consumer described this shoe as “casual but still classy”
Another consumer commented that the style of this shoe never gets old
A few number of purchasers commented that the shoe is easy to clean
The shoe is available in many color options
It is readily available online and in multiple retailers
The Club MEMT is also available in 4E or extra wide for those who need a roomier interior
cons: The Reebok Club MEMT is not as durable as the classic Reebok Club C and other Reebok shoes
Most purchasers were extremely disappointed that the pairs they acquired did not last long
The Reebok Club MEMT is very uncomfortable for many of those who have worn it
Many also observed that the outer sole is no longer stitched to the upper
The shoe runs narrow and fits small, as observed by many of the purchasers
A number of purchasers noted that this shoe has no arch support

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality, lasted less than six months
customer_reviews.text: Shoes looked nice when they arrived, but started falling apart almost immediately. My last pair of Reeboks lasted for six years, which was one of the reasons I bought another pair when they finally bit the dust. Unfortunately in the last six years they must have had some serious changes in quality, because this pair lasted less than six months before the sole completely separated from the rest of the show, not just on one but on both shoes. Horrible quality, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reha

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!! Five reasons why.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Took way too long to get here. 2. Shoes are incorrect size for measurement. Maybe even two sizes too small. I have black Reebok's size 11 and NB size 11 running shoe and they both fit fine. 3. Called Reebok and they said they don't support this shoe. Its more than likely a copycat or pirating their name. 4. Could not get customer support because because shoes made in Vietnam. 5. Buyer beware. You buy your stuck. Don't trust the Prime recommended logo. Ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: DanGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. I bought a 1/2 size bigger and it was spot on. Good decision. Look and feel wonderful. Great price too. I was looking for the ones I wore in the 80s with the black rubber bottom instead of white but I think I like this better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unconfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a wide shoe and this one kept coming up but it does not let you indicate width anywhere. After reading the reviews I thought I would give them a try. Not a good idea, they are way to slender and hurt my feet way too much. I am hoping that the shoe trees will stretch them a bit but am not holding out hope! Unless you have a narrow foot do not purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Reebok Men's Club MEMT Classic Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are nice, and finding the 4E wide was a huge relief! They fit great, and as expected of Reebok. The shoe upper is nice quality and comfortable. BUT!!! , They dont hold up!, the sole is thin!!, dont kick anything while wearing these! do NOT wash them and toss them in the dryer, the old ones may have taken this, these will FALL APART if you do!, the sole to upper bond is horrid! This kind of poor quality is worthy of a shoe bought at the dollar store, wait, thats an insult to dollar stores!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J

customer_reviews.title: Length great width we all know about that
customer_reviews.text: There sneakers. There not ment for extreme comfort. They arrived early and undamaged. I'm borderline wide foot and wish they offered that option. After some wear they should be fine. They look great and were already laced. I re-laced them for style. I got a great deal for show shoes. Note I usually have to by 11 for guaranteed fit but tried the 10.5 an it worked. Plus I get 11 because the add width. 10.5 has enough toe length.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Bad shoe, horrible sole
customer_reviews.text: Who would've guessed that 2mm of memory foam as a insole feels like a brick?? Will kill your feet. Order an insert. Ordered wide. Box said wide - tongue didn't. Not sure if shoe is wide or not, ordered up a size anyway. Would've preferred a tad wider. After a week of wear, the (fake) leather outer is losing its color on the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Has Reebok Changed.
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe and have worn the Club C's for a very long time. However lately they are not holding up as well as they had. On this pair of shoes, there was a tag from Reebok International that stated: " Due to material complexity, this product is intended only for occasional wear. Material may crease and/or break at flex points with overuse." This makes me question Reebok's commitment to make fine tennis shoes. And what is overuse. You should be able to wear these shoes until they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: jjrj2130

customer_reviews.title: That I can trust products I buy to be exactly what is described on Amazon’s website.
customer_reviews.text: My biggest beef is with Reebok and Amazon. Amazon indicates that they are made of leather. They are not. They are made of man-made materials. You can actually smell the plastic or whatever they are made of! This is false advertising by both Reebok and Amazon. I’m a frequent purchaser of goods sold by Amazon but am becoming leery of the claims made. Because purchasing online is so big, and customers cannot inspect the product prior to purchasing, it would behoove Amazon to be accurate in their description of the products they promote. Amazon needs a quality control department to verify claims made by manufacturers and by Amazon’s website.
customer_reviews.author: DLK

customer_reviews.title: I’ve been buying this shoe for 15 years
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing these shoes for the last 15 years, well this model anyway. I typically get one or two years out of a pair of this model. My favorite thing is it’s a classic design that never goes out of style. When my shoes wear out, I simply reorder the exact same shoe and size. I no longer have to waste time going to the store to pick a shoe out and try different sizes. I wear this for every day use and occasionally I sneak a pair on for formal occasions. Great shoe and k hope it never gets discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Not the shoe I've been buying for 15 years.
customer_reviews.text: I've been purchasing the same shoes for 15 years. I normally purchase 10 pair at a time. Recently I've noticed some retailers selling these fakes. These are either knock offs or a version meant for sale in China. There's nothing to the sole. The shoes are not even made to human dimensions. They've got no arch, and they're very narrow. The colors are off too. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear Reeboks all the time. For a while I have been wearing New Balance but wanted to go back to my favorite show. Well, I was disappointed. The sole of the shoe is so thin you can feel every rock you step on. The shoe is tight and you feel all the panels pressing against your foot. As for the Memory Foam, I think that is just a gimmick. Once you step on it it's flat as a pancake. So I went back to New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: George Abihider

customer_reviews.title: No Longer A Quality Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Reebok Club C sneakers are not as good as they used to be. As a matter of fact they now suck. The sole and the trim that's glued around the toes on this model have separated -- poor glue adhesion, I'd guess. Good old "off-shore" quality. I threw out this pair out after lightly using them for about a year. They used to last much longer than that but not any more. I can no longer recommend them. Save your money and buy someone else's sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spalmacin

customer_reviews.title: Quality definitely going downhill from years past.
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Reeboks but the last two pairs I've ordered for my father have separated all around the toe. The first pair did this after he'd worn them for several months so I didn't think much of it, but the last pair I bought in June for Father's Day separated in exactly the same way in a matter of a month and a half. I'm going to re-order another pair today for Dad and hope this new pair holds up better, because this particuclar Reebok style fits his feet perfectly. I'll update this review after he's had his new shoes for a month or so, unless they separate sooner than that.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy J. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: not sure how .. but this 'name brand' Reebok product is way small  .. avoid
customer_reviews.text: sizing is a major problem with items designed for a group of people that are generally smaller than Americans .. which I usually am understanding and watchful of .. but did not think it would be a problem with Reebok .. in the close drop clearly marked as smaller size .. hopefully somebody needy is enjoying the new white kicks
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Does this shoe have the previous quality known for Reebok?
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in June 2019 in USA it is now October 2019 the wear is nominal but the factory glue has disintegrated. Do not buy these NEW Reeboks I suspect sweat shop labor is triumphing again to the detriment of the workers and the enrichment of the task masters to make the rich a buck and we have no quality. Better off having bought sandals and I do not wear sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love ‘Em?
customer_reviews.text: Maybe love would be a litt,e strong for how I feel about these shoes, but I’ve had them for about a month and wear them about every other day. Considering I have about 18 other pairs of tennies, I guess I like them a lot. We have a gravel drive and the sole does a more than satisfactory job of protecting my super sensitive feet. Arch support is good but my arches are so high, they seldom touch. For a casual shoe, they are great. They look good and for the price, are extremely well made. The only reason they don’t get 5 stars is they run a tad narrow, but that seems to be a general Reebok thing.
customer_reviews.author: Cubby

customer_reviews.title: Reebox classic shoe sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Reebox classic sneaker very confortable love this classic shoes sneaker i use to rock them in the mid 80 n 90 very good sneaker that why i bought them after so many years i don't wear one of this classic shoes n now i got diabetic neuropathy i really need this snickers for now i bouth 4 pair of the classic reebok the classic high top black n a pair in white high top i got so many sneaker but the Reebok are the best still
customer_reviews.author: edgardo martinez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for him.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has to wear a brace on his lower leg that goes under his foot as well. He had such a hard time finding a shoe that would allow the brace in the shoe without it smooshing his foot. He needed some black shoes that he could wear to church and regular leather dress shoes just don't work. These are perfect for him. We were so glad to find them on Amazon. He had another pair of these that lasted for 20 years! (He only wears them to church.)
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent / Comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great! They look good, they fit good, the insoles are crazy comfortable and they easy to clean. Highly suggest!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon E.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: after reading the reviews about the sizing being small I went ahead and ordered a half size bigger and was glad that I did because it fits perfectly. After wearing these shoes in for a couple of days I really like them they're comfortable and they go with almost any outfit you want to wear. Can't beat it for the price either.always preferred Reebok to the other big brands like Adidas or Nike because they are cheaper but still a good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Max DR

customer_reviews.title: NOT the same Reebok's I've been wearing.....
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT the same Reebok's I've been wearing for the past 20 years. I have a narrow foot and the pair I received are WIDE 'D or E' size. The shoe is Wide on my narrow foot--- And I've bought plenty of them over the years. I do not believe the shoe is the same quality, fit and finish. The shoe I got last IS wide and I'm uncomfortable and unsure of stability. I believe the upper portion of the shoes are Man Made Materials. Prices have either gone up or quality had gone down. Hate to say it, but guess I'll have to start looking else where... Shame! Tell Reebok to return to the former Crew shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Gene B

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE SHOES! Shoes were missing insole...like walking on cardboard.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband. These Reebok's are the only tennis shoe he will wear. However, this pair was missing the insole inside of both shoes. He says they are literally like walking on cardboard. Unfortunately, my husband waited for his old pair to wear out before wearing his new ones, so we are passed the time frame of being able to return them. I seriously doubt we would risk purchasing these shoes in the future...
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Going Into the Trash
customer_reviews.text: Terrible fit, at least a half size too small. No arch support. Not the same Reeboks that I have been buying for years. Just awful. I will be throwing them out.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Bad sizing
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing a size 10-1/2 Reebok for the last 20 years. The shoes on my feet are that size and brand. That size is too big now and the 10 is too small. I had no patience to try a 10 wide. Does it really have to be so difficult?
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: they said the best they were were a "D" width
customer_reviews.text: They indicated that they were 4E wide and they were not! Shoemaker stretched them twice, they said the best they were were a "D" width. Like the look, that was the only reason they were not sent back. Feel certain that after two stretchings they will work, still a bit snug! Would not recommend purchasing these. You would think Reebok would have what they say they have and would not try to slip in a size that that really isn't true!
customer_reviews.author: Ray G

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow and too small.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several pairs of these Reeboks over the years and always liked them and without any issues. But the ones I ordered were tight and narrow. Unfortunately, I don't believe they had an option for a wider pair in my size. So, I returned them. I've had a real issue with companies, name-brand or whatever, having their products made overseas and totally neglecting quality control. Wish they would get their act together!
customer_reviews.author: Alias

customer_reviews.title: Supposed 4E is not at all wide. WAAAY too tight and narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in a size 7 and supposedly "extra-wide" 4E. They are extremely tight and narrow, and my feet are not THAT wide. Either they are labeled incorrectly or they are knock-offs.
customer_reviews.author: A&R

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoes, a bit tight but they will give after a few wearings. Can't beat them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Micky B's.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper version of original Club C sneakers
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are a cheaper version of original Club C tennis sneakers. The sole is thinner and it not sewn to sides. I have a feeling that sides are bit lower than in Club C sneakers. If they are made of leather, then it is soft. I purchase a wide version, since my old sneakers were somehow tide. Those are wide enough; perhaps half size lower would be okay too. At least I can wear heavier socks. I hope they will last longer than they look. However I do not think I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Z

customer_reviews.title: Everything was right on point!
customer_reviews.text: I really like my sneakers. I have no complaints at all. The right size & width I ordered is exactly what I got, which has never happened when I've ordered them online. And my order even came a day earlier than i ordered on my prime membership, so basically.. I got my sneakers in a day after I ordered them. So there you have it.. no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Heck

customer_reviews.title: Big Chance
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually buy sneakers, boots and shoes online but I decided to give it a chance and everything I bought was not only affordable but fit well and I'm very happy I took that chance.
customer_reviews.author: David Cuevas Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I use the sneaker as a general purpose shoe. I use it for walking, mowing the lawn etc. My last pair was purchased in 2012. The only problem with that pair is the rubber sole separated from the shoe. The sneaker itself still looks as good a new. I didn't expect the shoe to last that long anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Otis Mcgrew

customer_reviews.title: not what they use to be
customer_reviews.text: i have never had Reebok come apart like these have. they are all glued together now. the bottom came apart from the inter shoe. and you can see there was no sticking, just rubber glue. it's almost like it was a Vietnam know off, wait, it was made there. save your money.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Reebook Sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different model of Reebok a month ago in the same size before I purchased these. The fit is totally different. These are much narrower and shorter. There is no arch support and they are not much better than going barefoot on rough terrain. They look good.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes,NOT FOR EVERYDAY USE.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes based on the style and how they look only.When worn after about a dozen times they start getting loose and a little yellowish. DO NOT BUY TO WEAR EVERY DAY!! Get these shoes only to add to your shoe arsenal.They look great but THEY WILL NOT LAST AS AN EVERYDAY SHOE!! Do yourself a favor if you are considering buying this product and take this review seriously.(I wear these shoes about 2 or 3 times a month because I like how they look)
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Rodriquez

customer_reviews.title: Work or play, love the classics
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these black classics for work for several years. They protect my feet and look better than the ordinary athletic shoe. After owning probably 10 pair, they changed the insole! The new gel insoles are too thin and is not as durable as the old ones. I simply added some Dr. Sholl’s basic insoles and they are great. WARNING! They run narrow. Don’t be afraid to buy the wides. Amazon has the best price too. I hope they make these forever
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Alan

customer_reviews.title: Reebok Men's Club Memt Classic Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this shoe comfortable but it is easy to clean. I love white sneakers and it looks great on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Narek

customer_reviews.title: I used to buy the Reebok Ace and these are the same fit and style.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the Reebok Ace "Tennis Shoes" for years; but couldn't find that particular model any longer. The Reebok Men's Club Memt Classic Sneaker are identical, down to the pattern of the sole. I love them! I did try a pair of New Balance 4E a while back, but there is no comparison to the comfort I find in the Reebok.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is looking but when i wear it it is not at all good my fingers are rubbing in the front toe of the shoe and doesn’t fit perfect i usually order 10.5 but ordered bigger number even thought it doesn’t fit good. I used the reebok brand before but this doesn’t seem like that it looks like some other forged this one.( i am not sure). Waste lf money
customer_reviews.author: praneeth

customer_reviews.title: No life in them
customer_reviews.text: These shoes aren't for walking that's not what they do. These shoes aren't for walking they'll fall right off you.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect labeling on the box and in the show
customer_reviews.text: This pair of shoes arrived marked as a size 10 on the box and in the shoe, and not size 10 M which I ordered and as it Show on the order. I tried them on and sure enough they are too narrow hence the reason for ordering the 10M. These shoes were also tight at the toes like they were too short. I matched these pair up to another new pair I had bought directly from Reebok and they look a full size smaller than they are marked. This is the second pair I am sending back because of this mislabeling. Dare I try again?
customer_reviews.author: Rick D

customer_reviews.title: No Foot Fatigue
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4" and weigh 255 Pounds. These Reebok Men's Club MEMT Sneaker are just what the Doctor ordered. They are lightweight but do a heavyweight job. The size 14 fits perfect. I'm on my feet over 8 hours a day. When I get home, there is no foot fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy2Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Quality not what you expect
customer_reviews.text: I saw these shoes locally but couldn’t find my 11.5 size they comfy (I added arch support) but I’ve worn them less than a dozen times to work in an office setting. Clean not wet or dirty. The toe pieces started to pull back and look pretty cruddy. You can see the underside of the leather is white and showing now. See photo. I’ll color them in and hope the rest of the shoes last better. Rebok should be ashamed. That piece of leather should be dyed throughout. I’ll not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Snedeker

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday casual shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great casual shoe, looks great and very comfortable. This is probably my 5th pair I've gone through and will keep buying them. Improvement made to the insole with more cushioning and greater stability. These are getting a little pricey though but the free shipping helps. Be forewarned, these run a little small so plan on getting a half size up from what you get normally.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and these fit really good. I used some inserts from superfeet since I actually need them for my heel. Can't really say much more since they are white with white soles. So, your feet will be lost in a snow storm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reebok walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear shoes size 9.5 but this shoe was too tight so I returned it and exchanged it with size 10 which fit my feet very well. It is comfortable, good feet support, arch support was OK as I expected higher arch. All in all it is a good shoe for walking as I purchased it before I went on a trip that required lots of city walking.
customer_reviews.author: pacsailor

customer_reviews.title: Look Great and Feel Great
customer_reviews.text: I wanted shoes that would look stylish with my casual outfits, and these fit the bill perfectly. They're comfy so I can walk around the city with them for hours without having my feet hurt. Only thing is that since they're white shoes they can get dirty pretty easily, but that's usually only from dirt and scuffs so if you're staying on the sidewalk and not kicking lampposts or stairs frequently then they should keep looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Langbert

customer_reviews.title: Thought I was purchasing a wider shoe but it seems to be the same as standard
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised that the wider option for this shoe is not much different than the standard fit. I ordered 10 4E US and had been wearing just the standard size before purchasing these and they still are super uncomfortable. I have both of them now and I do not feel the difference between the two. I cannot tell the difference from looking at them either and the tags do indicate that it is 4E. I measured my foot according to the specs and I guess this is just the way it is, but have been wearing Reebok for ages and have never had this issue with pain from wearing shoes like I do now.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Blessing

customer_reviews.title: to to small
customer_reviews.text: i wear a 9 1/2 ee shoe and i ordered a 10 1/2 and i could barely get my foot in it,i started to return and order a 11 maybe ,but they were out so i just settled for another type of shoe and took the refund,these shoes run extra small
customer_reviews.author: steven oliver

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorites!
customer_reviews.text: I have liked these shoes since they first hit the market years ago. I like the classics! I guess it stands to reason since I'm now a classic. Thank you for the perfect no hassle online shopping experience.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Whittle

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected they would be.
customer_reviews.text: They are nearly a duplicate of the ones I wore for 9 years until the sole came loose. I wanted no or few changes, and other than the look, that's what I got. They are not quite as wide as the old ones, but will work.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Charles

customer_reviews.title: See last line. Methinks that’s a song title.
customer_reviews.text: Nice flat sole with good squeaky grip. Would be perfect with normal feet, but I tore my leg to pieces in my teens leaving me semi crippled on the right. Now I’m coming up on 75 with a bad limp and no cute girl sympathy at all. Goddammit! The shoes are great though. Hey, by the way, where did all the cuties go? Do they still make ‘em? God I hate fouling out on a bum leg . . .
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Totally Retro!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pair of sneakers that aren't too flashy and go well with jeans and shorts. These Reebok classics provide just that and are easy to dust off and clean. The memory foam insoles do not provide enough cushion in my opinion but I can add different ones of my choice. Nonetheless, I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: UNHAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Sole is coming unglued from the shoe. Never happened before. I have been buying these for many years. SAD!
customer_reviews.author: wally arnold

customer_reviews.title: Absolutley ZERO arch support.
customer_reviews.text: No arch support. I don't remember ever wearing a sneaker that made me feel 100% flat footed (and I don't have flat feet). Other aspects of sneaker seemed ok, but it does not matter if you are going to do more than just stand in them (maybe that's what they are for?). I since bought Reebok Men's Club C 85 Fashion Sneaker ($8 more) and it has much better arch support (a little snug w/o even tightening the laces, but they should stretch-out).
customer_reviews.author: The Glazier's

customer_reviews.title: Upper material didn't seem to be leather
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of thinking that these shoes were there same quality as they were when I purchased my first pair in 1996. Feels like entire shoe is vinyl material. Bought several weeks ago and just opened today. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Only have 2 run faster than the slowest person to out run a  bear.

customer_reviews.title: too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I have, over the years i have bought about a dozen pairs of Reebok shoes because they were consistently wider than other brands, having gone form a size 13 to now 14 shoe... the last pair i bought which was labeled as 14 wide seems very narrow and hurts my feet... not sure if it was mis labeled or what... but pretty disappointed and may need to give them away as i can't wear them... i was an offensive lineman in my younger days, and it is really hard to find shoes that are comfortable... a 2 star rating is probably too high
customer_reviews.author: R. D.

customer_reviews.title: Trusted name brand
customer_reviews.text: Reebok is a very trusted name brand... and these shoes were great. I think my feet are just a little wider than normal but apart form that they are comfortable and I know they are durable for a fact!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro R. Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: The Don't Fit!
customer_reviews.text: My other Reebok size 9M shoes fit fine. These are too short and too narrow. I would like to return them but I think that I have passed the time limit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: The Chinese are making things a little smaller these days!
customer_reviews.text: First I bought a 91/2, my regular size - too small. Then I got size 10. They fit ok but are a little too narrow. I've never had to buy shoes in a wide fit in my life. So I just think these shoes are being made too narrow. I can get buy with them and will keep them but they are not as comfortable as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: bobbyboy

customer_reviews.title: The back of the shoe is so low it's almost like a slip on mule slipper.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the height of the shoe. It looked normal in the pictures but it is very low in the bac. As I need the extra wide shoe to support my full foot orthotic, it is a struggle to push my foot in without crushing the back. I don't need my foot to come out of the shoe throughout the day. I kept them ONLY because I was in dire need of something to wear that day!
customer_reviews.author: Jabry

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Reebok club C for many years. These may look the same but are definitely not made to the same standard. There is virtually no support in these shoes and the soles are extremely thin and flimsy. You can squeeze these between your index finger and thumb and the sole will completely collapse. These are half a step up from being bare footed. I would rate them a zero if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A Larvenz

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These are becoming harder to find as time goes on. I do not like the new tennis shoes that come out with all different colors and wild mixes of colors. I have worn this shoe for over 40 years (it has had a few little changes in that time but they remain all white) but they are still my favorite shoe to wear everywhere. I started out using them to play tennis in graduate school in 1975 and have had a pair in my closet ever since. Glad you have them available and hope you continue to carry them especially at this price. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ramon Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn these shoes for 3 months and they’re already falling apart. The front foxing is already coming off of the toe cap and hanging off the front of my shoe! I bought one pair that lasted me almost a year before I had any issues, but the quality on this pair is way worse
customer_reviews.author: Mason Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Small I was so busy I opened the box after I could return it. Smh
customer_reviews.author: Clint S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my uncle who is an active priest in a school in El Salvador. He loves the shoes. He likes them because he can wear them anytime and look professional.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B.

customer_reviews.title: BAIT AND SWITCH
customer_reviews.text: Not what I ordered or what was on the picture, ....these have the cheap plastic white soles....the ones pictured had the blue rubber soles with the blue liner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable for long days on your feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are ok, the built in memory foam in the sole does very little to cushion your feet after a long day at work. I definitely thought they'd be more comfortable. I have other shoes with thinner soles that still seem to provide better support. If you are a person who is on your feet alot look elsewhere. That being said, that build quilt is nice and if all your looking for is a nice shoe for leisure activities this will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Not a wide-sized shoe though sold as such
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the "extra wide" size. What I received was normal width, though the box indicates "4E." It is not at all wide - not in the least. I have purchased wide-size from Reebok in the past so I can only assume that Reebok no longer produces that size, but instead just relabels the box. I will keep these and hope that they stretch out with wear. But I will not order them here again.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Filippo

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Narrow for a 4E
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 4E width and it is definitely too narrow for a 4E and I did confirm it is labeled 4E width. Opinion, it's a tight EE at best.
customer_reviews.author: DesertRSL

customer_reviews.title: My husbands favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: This Reebok is my husbands favorite shoe, so glad we can find it online since it is never available in a brick and mortar. fits like its supposed to. looks as described and as the picture depicts.
customer_reviews.author: dawn walker

customer_reviews.title: Style
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, great style, comfortable and not too expensive. May buy a 2nd pair because as i typically do with white shoes I have already worn them somewhere i shouldn't... they clean up good though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: there was no padding and it was like waking with out shoes
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wolford

customer_reviews.title: This pair came with pubic hair
customer_reviews.text: This pair came with multiple pubic hairs inside of the shoes
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with these shoes so far, I spend a lot of time on my feet and they provide enough support to get me through my regular 10 hour days. Fit is a tiny but snug but not enough to justify going up another size.
customer_reviews.author: TheJeff

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as my other reeboks
customer_reviews.text: They just seem like cheap knock offs from China, I own several pair, save all my old ones to do yard work in etc. But these things are lighter, feel narrower, feels like thin soles, about half the padding as most shoes, no arch support, my feet hurt after walking 4 blocks, I heard Adidas bought out Reebok, if this is the case they have Ruin the company and Quality of Reebok, Also heard Adidas are closing Plants in Atlanta etc and moving everything to China, if this is the case I wont buy either brand again !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Look good BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I've now had the sneakers for 16 months. They look good and are comfortable BUT... after about six months the leather started separating from the sides! I've now had to use Gorilla Glue four times to reattach the leather to the sides. I've never had any previous sneakers fail in thie way. Although I like the styling, I won't be buying these sneakers in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I play a lot of pickleball both indoors and out and these shoes are prefect and very comfortable. This is my second pair and I just ordered another pair. FYI: The women's 8-1/2 in the exact type of shoe is the same as the men's 6-1/2. You could order either one and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Becki Subido

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 pairs of this shoe before playing tennis. I used another pair for a year then ordered these on line not allowing to check fitting. These shoes about killed my toes after one use and I gave them to my son who does not wear a size 13. I like the shoe but the sizing is too small
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: I bought 'em before and I've bought 'em again!
customer_reviews.text: These were the same as the ones I bought last year but feel a bit narrower. Quality is still good. We moved and I couldn't find these locally despite having a mall just a couple of miles away. Amazon came to the rescue. I'm too old for basketball shoes with thick soles and I don't want loud colors. These hit the spot again.
customer_reviews.author: David Heil

customer_reviews.title: Good but design tapers at front causing me pinky toe pain.
customer_reviews.text: Super white attractive sneaker. Wish the insole had more padding. The inside bottom of the shoe felt uncomfortably flat. While the size I ordered is 4E width, I found it a bit narrow around my toe's pinkies. That part of the shoe starts to taper causing the pinkies to start rubbing in the shoe causing discomfort. Outside of that a fair shoe. The bottom design under the shoe does not offer much traction say in foul weather.
customer_reviews.author: G.V.

customer_reviews.title: Not like the one's you get in stores.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of disappointing. I ordered these from Amazon. I wear size 11 and according to the shoe imprint size 11 is what was shipped but the shoes are too tight and don't offer the same support I have grown accustomed to with Reebok. These don't seem to have near the cushioned feel. I will not order shoes online again. This is the 3rd time I have order (from different places) online and I have only been satisfied once. I think I know now why they were under $35. I have already worn them so I will not try to return. They will have to do for now though.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey T.

customer_reviews.title: Iconic shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have worn these for many years and while having to change sizes periodically they're always exactly the same. The quality is quite consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Kirwan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sole and arch support
customer_reviews.text: The soles are so thin, it's like they glued a sneaker top to a pair of flip flops. You'll feel every sidewalk crack, pebble and twig you step on. I can't wear these anymore and will get rid of them.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck R.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: So based on reviews, I got a size bigger. I'm a size US13 so I got US14. It fit perfectly. I have wide feet and it still fit good even though I just got normal size 14. Not to tight from the sides or top to bottom. All that's left to do is comfortable issues and see how long they last. 5 stars for me. Plus for $20? Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AbelG

customer_reviews.title: Run large and you need inserts for comfort
customer_reviews.text: You definitely will find them larger than your signs. And you most likely will need to purchase inserts because the shoes are very uncomfortable without them.
customer_reviews.author: JOHNNY DOLLAR

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Reebok sneakers for quite a few years and the fit is always good. The cushioning seems to be a little thinner than in past years, but still acceptable for every day use. Good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: They were too narrow and too small
customer_reviews.text: They were too narrow and too small. I gave them to my son who has much smaller feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Seem to have no arch support whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty average feet, and I’m not overly picky about my tennis shoes. But these seem to have no support whatsoever. Very flat and not all that comfortable. I had to put in after market arch inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not True to Size. Run Small.
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT run true to size like the description says. I ALWAYS wear a 9.5 in sneakers however I had to exchange them for a 10.
customer_reviews.author: Ex-NCPD

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY..THEY ARE COUNTERFITS
customer_reviews.text: THESE SHOES DO NOT FIT PROPERLY AT ALL! VERY VERY UNCOMFORTABLE ONE WAS MADE IN KOREA AND THE OTHER VIETNAM!!!! BUYER BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wright

customer_reviews.title: Run narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I had always worn Reebok size 9D . These were 9 regular and they were very narrow. Had to return them and get xxx wide.
customer_reviews.author: James p.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, these are the best Sneakers!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Men' Club Memt Fashion Sneaker (with blue highlites) - This is a very nice fashion sneaker. I dressed them up with Hickies shoelaces, and a tform insert on the insole. The insole is unique, being so thin I was surprised how well it cushioned my feet. I did purchase a similar style (but not identical) last year, and for those shoes I would agree with the negative comments posted below. I was glad I took the risk, and ordered these.😉
customer_reviews.author: Bamm Bamm Bahama

customer_reviews.title: Great Look but it will fall apart
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look of this shoe and the wide fit was great, but it was clearly made by cutting some corners in quality. If you expect a shoe to last more than a few months without inside of the shoe falling apart, then you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Haag

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe
customer_reviews.text: Husband is very picky, and these earned a five star review! He's bummed that these are not very abundant anymore. The only place he can get them is to order them.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Tincher

customer_reviews.title: Thin soles and padding.
customer_reviews.text: The sole of the shoes are thinner than the previous pair (same model and brand) and I think they are probably thinner than a pair of leather mocassin's soles would be. I will keep the shoes and wear them but, I will not order more due to there basically being no padding in the soles of the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: kurt schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Narrow shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are too narrow and hurts parts of my foot
customer_reviews.author: EAC

customer_reviews.title: Not an everyday shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love the look. Padding is soft but the soel is very thin. As long as you don't wear them daily they should last a little while but as an everyday shoe, they won't last. Sole should have been much much thicker imo.
customer_reviews.author: S10e user

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the classic look
customer_reviews.text: Nice price classic look for the summer ...nothing fancy just a good old sneaker with great gription...i have 2 pair i would recommend and will probably buy again when rubber wheres thin
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

product_meta.title: Reebok Club MEMT, Men’s Club MEMT
product_meta.description: Reebok was founded for one of the best reasons: athletes wanted to run faster. In the 1890s, Joseph William Foster made some of the first known running shoes with spikes. Until 1895 he worked in the management by hand for top runners and long ago his new company, j.W. Foster and sons, developed an international customer of renowned athletes.
